definition: a person who shows skill at shooting a gun
a person who shows skill in accurate shooting
the situation that exists as a result of an important (and usually unpleasant) event, especially a war, an accident, etc.
either of the long, curved teeth that stick out of the mouth of elephants and some other animals
a small round green seed, eaten as a vegetable. Several peas grow together inside a long thin pod on a climbing plant also called a pea.
a person who takes goods into or out of a country illegally
a platform in a harbour where boats come in to load, etc.
a truck, or a container with wheels, that is pulled by another vehicle
a vehicle without an engine, that can be pulled by a car or truck or used as a home or an office when it is parked
a small building for people to live in that is made in a factory and moved to a permanent place
a series of short scenes from a film or television programme, shown in advance to advertise it
showing caring feelings and love for somebody
the act of writing your name at the end of an official document to show that you accept it
a person who has just signed a contract to join a particular sports team or record or film company
the act of making an official contract that arranges for somebody to join a sports team or a record or film company
the act of using sign language
a long curved part of a coast or river
to fasten or join one thing to another
to send an electronic document with an email
to believe that something is important or worth thinking about
to join somebody for a time, sometimes when you are not welcome or have not been invited
to be connected with somebody/something; to connect something to something
causing feelings of sympathy; making you feel sad or emotional
causing strong, often sad, feelings about somebody/something
changing from one place or position to another
